main.name: Rotary Club of Himalaya Patan
main.description: People of Action. Rotary is where neighbors, friends, and problem-solvers share ideas, join leaders, and take action to create lasting change
main.bio: Paul Harris, the father of Rotary Movement, was born on April 29, 1868.  When he passed on 27 January, 1947, he left behind for making a rich legacy  of fellowship and brotherhood for international understanding and services  to humanity. Today, the seed he sowed in 1905 has blossomed into a large  tree having 1.2 million Rotarians across the globe.

projects.title: Rotary Community Heart Care Center
projects.description:
Under the Presidency of Rtn. Rajendra Tandukar i.e Rotary Year 2013-2014, Rotary Club of Himalaya Patan (RCHP) approached Manidol Tole Sudhar Samiti (MTSS) to establish Heart Hospital in Shankhamul Town Planning Area, Lalitpur for which  
MTSS generously provided the plot of lan (9,000  
sq.ft) for the construction of hospital facilities. 
The concept later on endorsed by the Rotary  
International District 3292 (RID 3292) during  
governorship of DG Dilendra Raj Shrestha, proposed  
the project as RID 3292 Rotary Community Heart  



Care Center and Nepal Heart Foundation, Lalitpur (NHFL) joined as fourth implementing organizations  of the project. 
RCHP has taken the responsibility of fund raising for  the project, NHFL has agreed to take the responsibility  of operational part of the hospital and RID 3292 will be responsible for providing equipments necessary for the hospital with the support from different foreign  Rotary Clubs, Rotary Districts and The Rotary Foundation as well. The proposed Rotary Community Heart Care Center will be a 25-bed community care center and registered as a non-profit community hospital. It  will operate on subsidized service charges on self sustaining basis.

projects.title: My School Bag
projects.description:
To supplement the post relief program on  
education in 2015, Rotary Club of Himalaya  
Patan (RCHP), in coordination of Rtn.  
Sanam Shakya initiated to distribute the  
school bag containing basic stationary  
materials to students from grade I-V.  
Beneficiary children were from the affected  
areas of Lalitpur, Nuwakot, Gorkha and  
Kavre districts. The project started with  
the seed amount of NPR 50,000.00 and  
fund being multiplied after launching the  
projects, RCHP set the target of distributing  
100k students around the district. The club  
achieving 2000+ distributions in the first  
year of 2015. The project continues as flat  
sheet project to fullfill the target. 
Seeing the popularity and effectiveness  
of the projects, many generous people,  
Rotarian, Rotaractors, people and  
institutions have contributed and promised  
to fund the project and RCHP is all set  
delivering the primary needs of educational  
materials to school children.

projects.title: One School a Year
projects.description:
The devastating Gorkha earthquake of April 25, 2015 caused many deaths, casualties,  damages of many private and public structures. Among many damages, 7923 schools  building were affected causing the thousands of children being forced to take education  under open sky or temporary bamboo shelters. 
Many helpful hands came  
forward to re-establish/ 
rehabilitate the demolished  
structures and to retain the  
deprived students. In the  
same line, Rotary Club of  
Himalaya Patan (RCHP) in  
initiation of Rtn. Santa Ratna  
Shakya decided to launch  
the “One School a Year” project. Son  
of Light (SOL)-Nepal, SOL-Japan,  
SOL-Germany and Smile for Nepal  
(SN) agreed to support RCHP in this  
generous effort to give back smile in the  
faces of children securing their rights of  
education.  
RCHP and SOLs have rebuild two schools at Makaising-Gorkha and Dalbhanjyang-Gorkha  in 2015 and 2016 respectively and dedicated to continue as the name of the project “One  School a Year”

projects.title: Class Room Painting
projects.description:
Environment is an issue  
that evolves within  
every organizations and  
mind of every human  
in this developing  
age. Environment can  
be differentiated in  
two sectors. Natural  
Environment and  
learning environment.  
Rotary Club of Himalaya  
Patan (RCHP) decided  
to take the “learning  
environment” in its projects. In association with Partners-in-service “Rotaract Club of  Himalaya Patan” conceptualized its thought of working environment into reality by painting  classroom based Montessori approach in the government schools.  
Supporting the  
children and students  
in kind is not enough  
to bring smile in  
the little faces but  
also to make them  
equipped with their  
basic requirements  
and provide them  
the “learning  
environment” that  
draws them towards  
the light of education.  
RCHP in the year 2006, in mentorship of Rtn. Biso Bajracharya & Rtn. Nabin Man  Shrestha, initiated the classroom painting with child friendly pictures and images making  the classrooms child friendly learning environment. 
The first project accomplished at Patan High School-Lalitpur in 2006 and continues  till by education committee.

projects.title: Hamro Pani Dashain
projects.description:
Dashain being one of the greatest festival of Nepalese is celebrated with great enthusiasm  all over the country by every citizens. Each and every invites one another to be a part of  festive celebration. However, certain groups are left isolated becoming a part of seasonal  occasion.  
RCHP in its charter year 2003,  
under the coordination of President  
Rtn. Biso Bajracharya, launched  
the project “Hamro Pani Dashain”  
on the eighth day of Festival “Maha  
Asthami” for the isolated group “Street  
Children”-children being forced to live  
in the street due to many reasons.  
SATHSATH –an organization working  
with such groups joined hand in  
organizing Tika Program and feast.  
The blessings for the children were bestowed by  
Late Rtn. Gopal Raj Rajbhandari, Rtn. Dr. Tika Man  
Vaidya and Rtn. Dilendra Raj Shrestha and other  
district officials then. 
RCHP, now commemorating its 14th year, the flavor  
of project still continues among the different groups  
that are also being isolated from the society during  
the occasion. One of the groups are Senior Citizens  
in oldage home.  
One day event is being scheduled every year for  
these groups with its partners-in-service, Rotaract  
Club of Himalaya Patan . RCHP aims to do something  
to both the groups at least for the day to cheer them  
up and to express the moment which gave the ripple  
effect of happiness.
